title: The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire
summary: The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire[lower-alpha 1] is a six-volume work by the English historian Edward Gibbon. It traces Western civilization (as well as the Islamic and Mongolian conquests) from the height of the Roman Empire to the fall of Byzantium in the fifteenth century. Volume I was published in 1776 and went through six printings.[1] Volumes II and III were published in 1781;[2][3] volumes IV, V, and VI in 1788–1789.[4][5][6][7][lower-alpha 2]
